subject: Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... I m sure our friends from the Antipodes have never given anyone cause to worry yet they come up a great deal in our discussion. So to have something more
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ted Larson Freeman"
<freeman@...> wrote:
>
> Don't worry about the Australians.
>


I'm sure our friends from the Antipodes have never given anyone cause
to worry yet they come up a great deal in our discussion. So to have
something more concrete, I built a sheet for the Australian accent by
researching their vowel mergers and applying our QS rules. It is *not*
a product of personal experience and should be regarded as tentative
pending a review by an actual Australian.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Pronunciation/australian.jpg

Notice particularly the IPA associated with each letter compared to
the chart for BBC English. Without the chart, FACE would probably have
been spelled with #30At instead of #29Eight which the chart
proscribes. Also LOT and CLOTH would have been spelled with #33Awe
instead of #34 Ox.

That is to say, if an Australian looks up the sound Kingsley Read made
for the word "awe" (which is /O/ ) he will see that it is the same
sound as an Australian uses for the word "lot" ( also /O/ ) But we are
telling him not to use the letter Awe but to use the letter Ox. We are
saying that the obvious reading of the QM is undesirable and I suppose
we will have to be very convincing as to why this is the case.
